alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Cheyenne and eastern Kit Carson Counties in east central Colorado, Wallace County in west central Kansas and southern Sherman Counties in northwestern Kansas through 615 PM MDT... At 529 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Stratton to 4 miles south of Sharon Springs. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Sharon Springs around 535 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Wallace. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 0 and 12. Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 411 and 450. Highway 385 between mile markers 169 and 199. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also possible with these storms and may lead to localized flooding and near zero visibility. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for east central Colorado. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for northwestern and west central Kansas.
